content: this is a summary of a legal text about a family court case in henegouwen on december 13th 2019 the case has been ongoing for 7 years and involves a dispute over matrimonial property regimes the court examined the establishment of a reward account within the partnership acquests even though the primary regime is one of separation of property the court affirmed that partnership acquests can function as legal community property allowing for a reward mechanism within the separation property framework the key principle highlighted was coherence which requires reward accounts to be established within the community system the case involved the sale of a property with the proceeds being used to repay loans including those jointly contracted by the spouses the court emphasized the need for proof that the proceeds were invested in the partnership acquests potentially entitling one spouse to a reward the parties failure to adequately explain this aspect led to the reopening of legal discussions the decision was based on article 1436 paragraph 1 of the civil code
